intro: Justicia japurensis, commonly known as the Japurá justicia, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest in South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Justicia japurensis is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
